Magni_utils module

class Magni_utils.Magni[source]

Bases: object

Implements a machine learning model based on Magni et al. for predicting optimal thread coarsening factors.

model

Trained model with optimized hyperparameters.

Type:

sklearn.model_selection.GridSearchCV

fine_tune(cascading_features: array, cascading_y: array, verbose: bool = False) → None[source]

Fine-tune the model on additional data.

Parameters:

  • cascading_features (np.array) – Array of feature vectors for fine-tuning.

  • cascading_y (np.array) – Labels for fine-tuning.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Flag for verbosity during fine-tuning.

init(args)[source]

Initialize model with hyperparameters and perform grid search for optimization.

Parameters:

args (argparse.Namespace) – Arguments containing seed and other parameters for model initialization.

predict(sequences: array) → array[source]

Predict optimal thread coarsening factor.

Parameters:

sequences (np.array) – Array of sequences for prediction.

Returns:

Predicted coarsening factors.

Return type:

np.array

predict_model(sequences: array)[source]
predict_proba(sequences: array)[source]

Returns the predicted probabilities of the images in X.

Paramters: X: np.ndarray of shape (n_sample, width, height, n_channels)

Images to predict.

Returns: np.ndarray of shape (n_samples, n_labels)

restore(inpath)[source]

Load a model from a specified path.

Parameters:

inpath (str) – Path to load the model from.

save(outpath)[source]

Save the trained model to a specified path.

Parameters:

outpath (str) – Path to save the model.

train(cascading_features: array, cascading_y: array, verbose: bool = False) → None[source]

Train the model on cascading features.

Parameters:

  • cascading_features (np.array) – Array of feature vectors.

  • cascading_y (np.array) – Labels for classification.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Flag for verbosity during training.

class Magni_utils.ThreadCoarseningMa(model=None, dataset=None, calibration_data=None, args=None)[source]

Bases: ModelDefinition

Wrapper class for managing data partitioning, feature extraction, and prediction.

model

Instance of the Magni model.

Type:

Magni

calibration_data

Data used for model calibration.

Type:

np.array

dataset

Placeholder for dataset attribute.

Type:

None

data_partitioning(dataset, platform='', mode='test', calibration_ratio=0.2, args=None)[source]

Partition dataset into training, validation, and test sets.

Parameters:

  • dataset (str) – Path to dataset.

  • platform (str, optional) – Platform for filtering data.

  • mode (str, optional) – Mode of partitioning (‘train’ or ‘test’).

  • calibration_ratio (float, optional) – Ratio of data to use for calibration.

  • args (argparse.Namespace, optional) – Additional arguments for data partitioning.

Returns:

Partitioned data (features and labels).

Return type:

tuple

np.array

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Evaluation parameters.

Generate cascading features for Magni model.

Parameters:

  • oracles (pd.DataFrame) – Oracle coarsening factors.

  • platform (str) – Platform name for filtering data.

Returns:

Cascading features and labels for training.

Return type:

tuple

  • platform (str) – Platform name.

Returns:

np.array

Magni_utils.load_predict(model, args, model_pretrained='')[source]

Load a pre-trained model and make predictions on the test data.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Arguments containing configuration details.

  • model_pretrained (str, optional) – Path to the pre-trained model.

Returns:

Mean F1 score of predictions.

Return type:

float

Magni_utils.make_predictionMa(speed_up_all=[], platform='', model=None, test_x=None, test_index=None, X_cc=None)[source]
Magni_utils.make_prediction_ilMa(speed_up_all=[], platform='', model=None, test_x=None, test_index=None, X_cc=None, origin_speedup=None, improved_spp_all=[])[source]

Calculate speedup improvements using predictions from Magni et al. model.

Parameters:

  • speed_up_all (list) – List to store speedup values.

  • platform (str) – Platform for prediction.

  • model (Model) – Trained model for prediction.

  • test_x (np.array) – Test data features.

  • test_index (np.array) – Test data indices.

  • X_cc (np.array) – Cascading features for prediction.

  • origin_speedup (float) – Initial speedup value for comparison.

  • improved_spp_all (list) – List to store improvement values.

Returns:

Speedup, improved speedup, and data distribution.

Return type:

tuple

Magni_utils.restore_model(model, args, model_pretrained='')[source]

Restore a pre-trained model and calculate speedup on test data.

Parameters:

  • model (Model) – The pre-trained model to restore.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Arguments containing configuration details.

  • model_pretrained (str, optional) – Path to the pre-trained model.

Returns:

Average speedup achieved on test data.

Return type:

float

Train the underlying model on training data and evaluate speedup.

Parameters:

  • model (Model) – Model to train.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Arguments containing training configurations.

Returns:
